name: ActionScript 3
description: ActionScript 3 & MXML language extension for Panic Nova. LSP powered directly from Bowler Hat LLC's vscode-as3mxml. Develop apps for Adobe AIR, Adobe Flash Player, and maybe Apache Royale.

actionscript-flash.name: Flash
actionscript-flash.description: Build and run a Flash or Flex project.

actionscript-air.name: AIR
actionscript-air.description: Build and run AS3 or MXML project with AIR for desktops.

actionscript-android.name: AIR - Android
actionscript-android.description: Build and run AS3 or MXML project with AIR for Android devices.

actionscript-ios.name: AIR - iOS
actionscript-ios.description: Build and run AS3 or MXML project with AIR for iOS devices.

config.title: Java
config.description: Java is required for AS3MXML and other AIR tools like ADT and ADL.

children.title: Java Path
children.description: This setting may be used to specify the exact path to the java executable that the extension should use (Note: it must be an executable, and not directory).

config.title: SDKs
config.description: Here is where all setting for which AID SDKs to use

children.title: Default AIR SDK path
children.description: This is where the default Flex/AIR SDK will be. If empty, it will default to /Applications/AIRSDK.

children.title: SDK Search Paths
children.description: (*NOTE Not implemented yet.*) Specifies a folder path containing one or more SDKs to add as custom options in the SDK picker.

children.title: Adobe Animate executable
children.description: Specifies the absolute path of the Adobe Animate executable

children.title: Editor SDK path
children.description:
(Advanced) Specifies the folder path of the Apache Royale SDK used internally by the extension to provide code intelligence features. Unless you know what you're doing, you should probably set `as3.sdk.framework` instead.

If you are working on a project that uses a nightly build of Apache Royale, you may be required to specify the `as3.sdk.editor` setting to avoid compiler errors. Sometimes, new versions of Royale add new compiler options that older versions of compiler may not recognize.

children.title: iOS SDK path
children.description: For some ANEs in iOS, you will need to specify the iOS SDK to compile them. You can run from terminal `xcrun --sdk iphoneos --show-sdk-path` to get the paths. Or maybe someday I can make this "resolve" that as a drop down.

children.title: Android SDK path
children.description: Location of the Android SDK, default is `~/Library/Android/sdk/`

config.title: Language Server
config.description: This is where you can change some of the options for the AS3MXML language server

children.title: Language Server Path
children.description: Path to the AS3MXML LSP, if blank, it will used the bundled LSP.

children.title: JVM Args
children.description:
(Advanced) Specifies extra arguments that asconfigc will pass to the Java virtual machine when launching the language server (code intelligence).

The following example customizes the Java memory heap size for the code intelligence: "-Xms512m -Xmx1024m"

children.title: Concurrent Requests
children.description: (Advanced) Specifies if requests to the language server will be processed concurrently or in a queue. Disabling concurrency will result in slower code intelligence, but it may be more stable if code intelligence stops working.

config.title: File Exclusions
config.description: For all projects, these files will not be copied to the output folder after compilations.

children.title: Standalone Adobe Flash Player (debug version)
children.description: Location of debug version of Flash Player

children.title: Ruffle
children.description: Location of Ruffle.app

children.title: Browser with Flash Player
children.description: A web browser to launch a Flash Player page in (probably an real old version of Chrome or something)

children.title: Use custom data folder for old Chrome
children.description: Checking this will pass additional options, making an old version of Chrome or Chromium (prior to 88) use Flash, and a temp folder for user data

children.title: Prompt to import Flash Builder projects
children.description: When specificed, this will ask if you want to import Flash Builder projects when opening a project. If disabled, or you cancel it, you can still do this manually form the menu.

configWorkspace.title: Application
configWorkspace.description: Select the main ActionScript or MXML for the project

configWorkspace.title: ASConfig File
configWorkspace.description: For AS3MXML, you need to have an `asconfig.json` file for code intelligence. Select if you want to have this extension auto generate, or if you will manually maintain it.

configWorkspace.title: Build Packaging
configWorkspace.description:
Used for packaging AIR projects but not used in Flash projects.

These are the setting that will be used for building and running. Exporting release builds will default to these values, unless otherwise specified in the Task or if it is not supported for that type of Task

children.title: Certificate
children.description: Select the .p12 file to build your AIR app with

children.title: Timestamp
children.description: If you want to timestamp the packaging of your project, enable this. By unchecking it, it is the same as specifing "none" below for the Timestamp URL

children.title: Alternate Timestamp URL
children.description:
You can specify "none" or a specific URL of an RFC3161-compliant timestamp server to time-stamp the digital signature. If no URL is specified, a default time-stamp server provided by Geotrust (https://timestamp.geotrust.com/tsa) is used. When the signature of an AIR application is time-stamped, the application can still be installed after the signing certificate expires, because the timestamp verifies that the certificate was valid at the time of signing.

If ADT cannot connect to the time-stamp server, then signing is canceled and no package is produced. Specify -tsa none to disable time-stamping. However, an AIR application packaged without a timestamp ceases to be installable after the signing certificate expires.

children.title: Files to exclude when packaging
children.description: When packaging, these files will not be included. These can also be specified in the Task

configWorkspace.title: Build Path
configWorkspace.description: Set the source path and library path, as well as the output location for debug running

children.title: Main source folder
children.description: The location of your main file. Use "./" if you want it at the root, otherwise it defaults to "src"

children.title: Output folder
children.description: The location of where the final files get built. Use "./" if you want it at the root, otherwise it defaults to "bin-debug"

children.title: Output folder URL
children.description:
* Note: Flash only
The location of where the final files get built. Use "./" if you want it at the root, otherwise it defaults to "bin-debug"

children.title: Source Path
children.description: Additional source folders outside of the main source folder

children.title: Library Path
children.description: Additonal library folders to use when building. The Library Task can be used to set additional options for the library.

children.title: Component set:
children.description: When building a library, setting these will add the frameworks necessary for including the components necessary. Unlike Flash Builder, it will not list which onese are added. If you only want certain libraries, you can select `none` and manually add them below.

children.title: Build path libraries
children.description: You can choose to add either individual SWCs or folders of SWCs

children.title: Use local debug runtime shared libraries when debugging
Automatically determine library ordering based on dependencies
Native Extensions
children.description: For AIR projects: ActionScript Native Extensions (ANE) allow you to incorporate native platform capabilities into your applications and use them like standard libraries

configWorkspace.title: Compiler
configWorkspace.description: Selects options for compiling, like which SDK to use as well as other options when building for AIR and Flash projects.

children.title: Use the default SDK
children.description: Specifies the folder path of the ActionScript SDK used by the current workspace. Supports the Adobe AIR SDK & Compiler, Apache Royale, the classic Apache Flex or Adobe Flex SDKs.

children.title: Use a specific SDK
children.placeholder: If empty, defaults the one specified in the extention's preferences

children.title: Copy non-embedded files to output folder
Adobe Flash Player options
children.description: Settings for Flash only projects. These are ignored for AIR projects.

children.title: Use the default SDK
values: Use minimum version required by the Flex SDK
children.description: Specifies the minimum version of Adobe Flash Player. If using a specified version, please use the numbers below.

children.title: Adobe Flash Player HTML wrapper
children.description:
Settings for Flash only projects. These are ignored for AIR projects.
‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: If you change any of these options for the HTML wrapper, all files in the `htmi-template` folder of your project will be overwritten and/or deleted!

children.title: Which type of HTML to generate
children.description:
Specifies which type of wrapper to generate for the project.
Classic will use the default in the SDK.
Ruffle will supply a version that will generate a simple page (no history and the other options below are not used). Also, you will need to preview the page in Nova to run it.

children.title: Use Express Install
children.description: If check target is not checked, this will also remove the installer SWF

configWorkspace.title: Modules
configWorkspace.description: Specify the modules to build for this project. (NOTE: Not sure how to handle this, but it was in FB 4.6)

configWorkspace.title: Themes
configWorkspace.description: (Incomplete) For now, a flag to specify using Halo in Flex 4 projects.

children.title: Force Halo
children.description:
Enable this if you are trying to compile a Flex 3 project with an Flex 4 SDK. If building fails with the following types of errors, try to enable this option:

Error: The style '‚Ä¶' is only supported by type 'mx.‚Ä¶.‚Ä¶' with the theme(s) 'halo'.
